info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 03 at 2:04PM MDT until April 03 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Today For Portions of East Colorado as the Fire Weather Watch has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning. A Dangerous Fire Weather Day Will Unfold On Tuesday For Portions of Northwest Kansas... .Critical fire weather conditions are again expected across Kit Carson and Cheyenne counties in Colorado today as a Red Flag Warning has been issued. Dangerous fire weather potential is increasing for portions of northwest Kansas on Tuesday. Gusty to strong southwest winds will eventually become northwesterly as a cold front moves through the area; gusty to strong winds are also expected behind the wind shift. Blowing dust is also possible due to multiple days of warm and breezy conditions across the area. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 253... * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson. * Winds...Southeast 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
